commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Level 1: Echo feature for Exactly chatbot
Implement Level 2: Add and List functionalities for Exactly chatbot
Implement Level 3: Mark as done feature with Task classes for Exactly chatbot. Edit stuff the bot says to have more personality.
Implement Level 4: Add ToDos, Events, Deadlines with inheritance for Exactly chatbot
Implement A-TextUiTesting using I/O redirection for Exactly chatbot
Implement Level-5: Error handling for invalid inputs in Exactly chatbot
Implement Level 6: Add delete command and switch to ArrayList for task management
Implement A-MoreOOP (i think the previous one was buggy)
Add the ability to use Gradle to build
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/Leeisateam/ip into branch-Level-9
Add assertions and varargs support to TaskList and Exactly
commitResults.messageBody:
Assertions are added to document important assumptions, such as:
- Task description, file paths, and command inputs are not null or empty.
- Commands that require additional parameters have the expected tokens.
- Varargs method in TaskList ensures that all tasks provided are non-null.

Let's use Java's assert feature to catch potential errors during
development and document the preconditions of key methods. This
improves code robustness and serves as inline documentation for future
developers.

* Add assert statements in Task constructor, Deadline, Event,
  Parser, and getResponse.
* Implement an overloaded add() method in TaskList using varargs.
* Ensure important assumptions are verified via assertions.

- Refactored Exactly.java to separate core chatbot logic from UI concerns.
- Introduced getWelcomeMessage() and getResponse(String) methods for cleaner integration with GUI components.
- Enhanced error handling in the getResponse method with clearer exception messages.
- Reorganized code structure and improved formatting and documentation for increased readability.
- Removed redundant code and applied consistent coding style across the file.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Java Streams for filtering tasks in "find" command
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactored the "find" command in Exactly.java to use Java Streams. This update replaces the traditional for-loop
with a stream filter and collectors to retrieve tasks matching a given keyword. The changes improve code readability
and leverage Java’s modern Stream API for better maintainability.
Add assertions and varargs support to TaskList and Exactly

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge tag 'branch-A-Streams' of https://github.com/Leeisateam/ip into branch-A-Streams

Merge branch 'branch-A-Streams' of https://github.com/Leeisateam/ip into branch-A-Streams # Please enter a commit message to explain why this merge is necessary, # especially if it merges an updated upstream into a topic branch. # # Lines starting with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts # the commit.

commitResults.messageBody:
Users can currently add the same task multiple times, leading to redundant
entries in the task list.

Prevent duplicates by checking for an existing task with the same
representation before adding. If a duplicate is detected, inform the user
and skip the addition to keep the list clean.

The chat interface currently renders all text in the same generic area and
does not adapt well to window resizing. Errors are indistinguishable from
normal messages, and long replies force awkward single‑character wrapping.

Use a ListView with a custom cell factory to render asymmetric chat bubbles
for user input, bot responses, and error messages. Bind bubble widths to 60%
of the list’s width and enable text wrapping. Load styling from app.css to
apply distinct colors, padding, and error highlighting.

This delivers a polished, responsive UI that clearly separates message types
and improves readability without extra chrome.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: add user guide in docs/README.md
commitResults.messageBody:
The project lacks a dedicated user guide, making it hard for new users to
understand how to install, run, and use Exactly’s features.

Add a complete docs/README.md with sections on installation, CLI and GUI
usage, all available commands with examples and expected outputs, and
instructions to enable GitHub Pages.

This ensures users have a clear, concise reference and can view the guide
online via GitHub Pages.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Javadoc comments to all classes and methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently fewer than half of public methods have Javadoc comments,
which hampers API usability and fails the project’s documentation
coverage requirement.

Add Javadoc comments to every class and method, including private
helper methods, to exceed the 50% coverage threshold. This enhances code
readability, IDE support, and maintains consistency with the project’s
coding standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: GUI: fix input bar layout and add avatar images
commitResults.messageBody:
The input bar in MainWindow.fxml was not resizing and the FXML parser
threw errors due to missing imports. Import HBox and Insets, then
replace the standalone TextField/Button with an anchored <HBox> that
uses <padding> and HBox.hgrow="ALWAYS" on the TextField.

Also add user and bot avatar PNGs under /images and load them in the
MainWindow controller. These changes improve the GUI’s responsiveness
and complete the visual conversation by showing profile pictures

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: expand README with comprehensive user guide
commitResults.messageBody:
The existing README was brief and lacked detailed usage instructions
for both CLI and GUI modes. This update doubles its length by adding:

A clear introduction and feature overview

Step-by-step installation and run instructions

Complete command examples with expected outputs

Error message explanations and troubleshooting tips

FAQs, customization notes, and contribution guidelines

These enhancements ensure new users can quickly install, configure,
and use Exactly with confidence.
